albsavoia wrote:
> 
> 
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>, Robert 
> Martin <UncleBob@...> wrote:
>  > I don't feel bad about making private methods package scope in order
>  > to test them. Testing trumps encapsulation.
> ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
> 
> Thank you Bob for coming up with a clever and catchy answer to the 
> seemingly perennial
> "[how do/should] I test private methods" question.
 >
 > I really like the "Testing trumps encapsulation" phrasing because it
 > implies relative and not
 > absolute value judgements. It meets the spirit of Testivus
 > (http://www.artima.com/ <http://www.artima.com/>
 > weblogs/viewpost.jsp?thread=194506).

Ahem. Others have been saying exactly that for years, even in this list, 
or possibly in books, even almost exactly with those words. Just not in 
3 words. For that, I will forever be annoyed with Bob, because I usually 
love 3-word phrases, and I should easily have written that myself. Damn 
you, Bob! :)
